articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: The military has begun issuing tens of thousands of call-up orders for its reserve forces, looking to expand the Gaza campaign, its chief said.
articles.title: Netanyahu to convene ministers on new phase of Gaza war and aid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A missile launched from Yemen towards Israel on Sunday landed near Ben Gurion Airport, the country's main international airport, where footage shared on social media showed a plume of smoke visible from a passenger terminal.
articles.title: Missile launched from Yemen lands near Israel's main airport

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy, speaking at a news conference in Prague alongside Czech President Petr Pavel, said that unless increased pressure were applied, Vladimir Putin would take no real steps to end the conflict.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy, in Prague, says ceasefire could be put in place at any moment

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas has executed a number of alleged looters after several incidents in which heavily armed gangs attacked food stores and community kitchens in the Gaza Strip this week, sources close to the Palestinian militant group said.
articles.title: Hamas executes looters in Gaza as food crisis worsens under Israeli blockade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Justice Ministry said the recruiters identified themselves as members of Gaga's global fan base, known as the "Little Monsters."
articles.title: Brazil police foil bomb plot targeting packed Lady Gaga concert in Rio

articles.author: Christopher Scicluna
articles.description: An international NGO that intends to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza by sea said on Sunday it was in talks with Malta's government about allowing the vessel to enter Maltese waters to repair damage caused by a drone attack.
articles.title: NGO says it's in talks with Malta to repair Gaza-bound aid ship hit by drones

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: President Donald Trump said he was unsure whether people in the U.S. are entitled to due process rights guaranteed in the U.S. Constitution as his administration pushes aggressively to deport immigrants who are in the country illegally and other non-citizens.
articles.title: Trump says he's unsure whether people in the US are entitled to due process

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has congratulated Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese's election win in a phone call and the two agreed to bolster defence and security cooperation, Starmer's office said on Sunday.
articles.title: UK's Starmer talks defence cooperation with Australia's re-elected Albanese

articles.author: Steven Scheer
articles.description: The cancellations left El Al, Arkia and Israir with a near monopoly, full flights and higher air fares.
articles.title: Flights again halted to Israel after Houthi missile lands near airport

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Trump has been signaling for weeks that he is frustrated by the failure of Moscow and Kyiv to reach terms to end the war, though the Kremlin has said that the conflict is so complicated that the rapid progress Washington wants is difficult.
articles.title: Putin says Russia has the strength to finish Ukraine operation
